Work Up (Edge).title: Work Up (Edge)
Work Up (Edge).description: You learn the Move Work Up.

Weapon of Choice.title: Weapon of Choice
Weapon of Choice.description: Choose a specific weapon type. You gain a +2 Bonus on Opposed Rolls to prevent being disarmed while wielding weapons of your chosen type. If you would be disarmed anyway, you may pay 1 AP to prevent yourself from being Disarmed.

Wallrunner.title: Wallrunner
Wallrunner.description: You may run on vertical surfaces both vertically and horizontally for up to your Acrobatics Rank in meters before jumping off.

Virtuoso.title: Virtuoso

fields.value: A Skill at Master Rank, Level 20
fields.name: Prerequisites

Virtuoso.description: Choose a Skill at Master Rank. Consider that Skill to be effectively "Rank 8" for any Features or effects that depend on Skill Rank. Virtuoso may be taken multiple times, but you must choose a different Skill each time.

Traveler.title: Traveler
Traveler.description: You may use Survival instead of Athletics and Acrobatics to determine your Power Capability, High Jump, and Long Jump values. Determine your Overland Movement by substituting your Survival Rank for the lower of your Athletics or Acrobatics Rank.

Trainer of Champions.title: Trainer of Champions
Trainer of Champions.description: Whenever you apply Experience Training to a Pokémon, they gain an additional +5 Experience.

Train the Reserves.title: Train the Reserves
Train the Reserves.description:
You may apply Experience Training to a number of Pokemon equal to twice your Command Rank, instead of equal to your Command Rank.
Note: Beast Master or Groomer do not change the Skill that this Edge uses.

Touched.title: Touched
Touched.description: You have been blessed by a Legendary and gain their Minor Gift. This Legendary is considered one of your Patrons. You may take Touched multiple times, each time for a different Patron.

Throwing Masteries.title: Throwing Masteries
Throwing Masteries.description: Increase the Throwing Range of your Poké Balls, Ranged Weapons, and other small items by +2.

Tag Scribe.title: Tag Scribe
Tag Scribe.description: You create a Cleanse Tag. This may be used a number of times each day equal to half your Occult Education Rank.

Swimmer.title: Swimmer
Swimmer.description: You gain a +2 bonus to your Swim Speed. You may spend X minutes underwater before you begin to suffocate, where X is the higher of your Athletics or Survival Ranks.

Survival Drive.title: Survival Drive
Survival Drive.description: You learn the Move Bulk Up.

Stamina.title: Stamina
Stamina.description: Whenever you Take a Breather or take Massive Damage or a Critical Hit, you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your Athletics or Combat Rank after the triggering action has resolved.

Soulbound.title: Soulbound
Soulbound.description: Whenever your Patron feels strong emotions (positive or negative) or pain, those sensations will be shared with you, no matter the distance between you. You may take Soulbound multiple times, each time for a different instance of Touched.

Smooth.title: Smooth
Smooth.description: You gain +4 Evasion against Moves with the Social keyword, and gain a +2 Bonus on Save Checks against Rage and Infatuation.

Slippery.title: Slippery
Slippery.description: You may use your Stealth Skill when defending in Opposed Grapple, Push, or Trip checks. When Grappling, if you win an Opposed Check when using Stealth, you must choose to end the Grapple (you cannot choose to gain Dominance).

Skill Stunt.title: Skill Stunt

fields.value: A skill at Novice rank or higher
fields.name: Prerequisites

Skill Stunt.description: Choose a Skill you have at Novice Rank or higher. Choose a specific use of that Skill; when rolling that skill under those circumstances, you may choose to roll one less dice, and instead add +6 to the result. You may take this Edge multiple times, choosing a different circumstance each time.

Skill Enhancement.title: Skill Enhancement
Skill Enhancement.description: Choose two different Skills. You gain a +2 bonus to each of those skills. Skill Enhancement may be taken multiple times, but the bonus may be applied only once to a particular skill.

Shock Resistance.title: Shock Resistance
Shock Resistance.description: You don't suffer Augmentation Shock from Electric Type damage unless it is Massive Damage.

Scholar.title: Scholar
Scholar.description: You gain a +1 Bonus to Skill Checks with General Education, Medicine Education, Occult Education, Pokémon Education, Technology Education, and Survival.

Repel Crafter.title: Repel Crafter
Repel Crafter.description: Create a Repel for $100 or a Super Repel for $150. Requires access to a Chemistry Set.

Quick Case.title: Quick Case
Quick Case.description: You may remove a Case from a Poké Ball as a Swift Action. You may apply a Case to a Poké Ball as a Shift Action. (Normally these would be Shift and Standard Actions respectively)

Psychic Navigator.title: Psychic Navigator

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Psychic), Adept Perception or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

Psychic Navigator.description: You gain the Psychic Navigator Capability.

Pokébot Training.title: Pokébot Training
Pokébot Training.description: You may control a Pokébot with Complexity up to your Technology Rank by using a Pokémon turn.

PokéPsychologist.title: PokéPsychologist
PokéPsychologist.description: You may use your Pokémon Education Skill instead of Charm, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition when making general Skill checks to interact with Pokémon or to raise or lower disposition.

Poké Ball Repair.title: Poké Ball Repair
Poké Ball Repair.description: You may attempt to fix any Poké Ball that has failed to capture a Pokémon and broke. Make a Technology Check with a DC of 15. If you succeed, the Poké Ball is fixed and is treated as if it had not broken. If you fail, the ball is permanently broken. Requires access to a Poké Ball Tool Box.

Paleontologist.title: Paleontologist

fields.value: Novice Pokémon Education or Novice Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

Paleontologist.description: You can identify fossils with a DC 10 Pokémon Education or Survival Check. You know how to operate Reanimation Machines and can use them to revive Fossils. See the “Pokémon Fossils” section (page 216) for more information.

Nimble Movement.title: Nimble Movement
Nimble Movement.description: Whenever you Disengage, you Shift 2 meters instead of 1.

Mystic Senses.title: Mystic Senses
Mystic Senses.description: You may use Intuition instead of Charm to improve the disposition of Wild Pokémon. You may not take Mystic Senses if you have the Elemental Connection Edge, and you may not take Elemental Connection if you have Mystic Senses.

Mounted Prowess.title: Mounted Prowess
Mounted Prowess.description: You automatically succeed at Acrobatics and Athletics Checks made to mount a Pokémon, and you gain a +3 Bonus to all Acrobatics and Athletics Checks made to remain Mounted.

Minor Gift – World Serpent’s Embrace.title: Minor Gift – World Serpent’s Embrace
Minor Gift – World Serpent’s Embrace.description: You enter a trance and discern if any Legendary Pokémon are in the vicinity of the Scene, and gain a general idea of their location. For example, if one is in a cave way underneath you, you learn it is under you, but not exactly how to reach it.

Minor Gift – Twin Souls.title: Minor Gift – Twin Souls
Minor Gift – Twin Souls.description: You and the Mewtwo you are bound to may communicate telepathically, no matter the distance between you. You are also gifted the Soulbound Edge.

Minor Gift - Watchful Sleep.title: Minor Gift - Watchful Sleep
Minor Gift - Watchful Sleep.description: You may make Perception Checks to detect imminent dangers while sleeping.

Minor Gift - Vulcan's Intuition.title: Minor Gift - Vulcan's Intuition
Minor Gift - Vulcan's Intuition.description: You get a +3 bonus to Perception and Survival Checks made in mountainous and volcanic areas.

Minor Gift - Tower’s Rejuvenation.title: Minor Gift - Tower’s Rejuvenation
Minor Gift - Tower’s Rejuvenation.description: Resting now allows you to recover 1/10th of your maximum HP (a Tick) per half hour instead of 1/16th.

Minor Gift - Stoic Stature.title: Minor Gift - Stoic Stature
Minor Gift - Stoic Stature.description: You subtract half of your Athletics or Focus Ranks from the number of meters Push effects move you.

Minor Gift - Spirit of Justice.title: Minor Gift - Spirit of Justice
Minor Gift - Spirit of Justice.description: You may add your Spirit Modifier instead of your Body Modifier when making Combat Skill Checks. You get a +2 bonus to Disarming or resisting Disarming.

Minor Gift - Spatial Awareness.title: Minor Gift - Spatial Awareness
Minor Gift - Spatial Awareness.description: You intuitively know the size of an object or the distance between objects by sight down to the nearest centimeter for distances and lengths up to 10 meters.

Minor Gift - Seamaster.title: Minor Gift - Seamaster
Minor Gift - Seamaster.description: You treat deep water that you aren’t fully submerged in as Regular Terrain.

Minor Gift - Sailor's Guardian.title: Minor Gift - Sailor's Guardian
Minor Gift - Sailor's Guardian.description: Wild Pokémon up to a level of twice your Trainer Level will not attack or disrupt a water-borne vessel you are traveling on.

Minor Gift - Royal Privilege.title: Minor Gift - Royal Privilege
Minor Gift - Royal Privilege.description: You may wear Shards as a Trainer Accessory; when you do, you gain a +2 bonus to Skill Checks for the Skill linked to the shard’s color. Red is linked to Intimidate, Orange to Command, Yellow to Charm, Green to Intuition, Blue to Guile, and Violet to Focus.

Minor Gift - Rejuvenating Aura.title: Minor Gift - Rejuvenating Aura
Minor Gift - Rejuvenating Aura.description: When taking an Extended Rest, you and all Trainers and Pokémon in the vicinity are treated as if you spent the night at Poke Center, regardless of where you are.

Minor Gift - Plant Intuition.title: Minor Gift - Plant Intuition
Minor Gift - Plant Intuition.description: You reroll all dice that result in a roll of 1 when making Survival Checks related to plants. You automatically identify all berries and apricorns on sight.

Minor Gift - Perfect Timing.title: Minor Gift - Perfect Timing
Minor Gift - Perfect Timing.description: You always intuitively know what time it is and can accurately act as a human stopwatch.

Minor Gift - Motherly Compassion.title: Minor Gift - Motherly Compassion
Minor Gift - Motherly Compassion.description: You get a +3 Bonus to all Intuition and Charm checks for the purpose of discerning emotions and comforting someone.

Minor Gift - Landmaster.title: Minor Gift - Landmaster
Minor Gift - Landmaster.description: You treat Rough Terrain that is rocky or sandy or that is created by Groundshaper as Regular Terrain.

Minor Gift - Intuitive Sabotage.title: Minor Gift - Intuitive Sabotage
Minor Gift - Intuitive Sabotage.description: Whenever you make an Edu: Technology Check to destroy, sabotage, or otherwise disrupt modern electronics, you get a +3 bonus to your roll.

Minor Gift - Hero of Truth.title: Minor Gift - Hero of Truth
Minor Gift - Hero of Truth.description: You get a +3 bonus on Intuition Checks to discern when someone is lying.

Minor Gift - Hero of Ideals.title: Minor Gift - Hero of Ideals
Minor Gift - Hero of Ideals.description: You get a +3 bonus on Intuition Checks to discern someone’s beliefs and ideals.

Minor Gift - Hero of Balance.title: Minor Gift - Hero of Balance
Minor Gift - Hero of Balance.description: Others get a -3 penalty to Intuition Checks to detect your lies or discern your beliefs.

Minor Gift - Hands of the Creator.title: Minor Gift - Hands of the Creator
Minor Gift - Hands of the Creator.description: You get a +3 bonus to all Edu: Occult and Edu: General rolls to identify materials that would be used in crafting or the purpose of a crafted object.

Minor Gift - Fount of Knowledge.title: Minor Gift - Fount of Knowledge
Minor Gift - Fount of Knowledge.description: Choose two Education Skills. Reroll all dice that result in a roll of 1 when making Checks with those Skills.

Minor Gift - Force of Will.title: Minor Gift - Force of Will
Minor Gift - Force of Will.description: Reroll all dice that result in a roll of 1 when making Focus and Command Checks.

Minor Gift - Emotion's Heart.title: Minor Gift - Emotion's Heart
Minor Gift - Emotion's Heart.description: Reroll all dice that result in a roll of 1 when making Charm and Intuition Checks.

Minor Gift - Elemental Soul.title: Minor Gift - Elemental Soul
Minor Gift - Elemental Soul.description: You can sense the presence of Pokémon of a given Type within 10 meters of you based on which Legendary Bird or Beast granted you this Edge. Articuno grants Ice, Moltres and Entei grant Fire, Zapdos and Raikou grant Electric, and Suicune grants Water.

Minor Gift - Dream Mastery.title: Minor Gift - Dream Mastery
Minor Gift - Dream Mastery.description: You are immune to Hypnosis, Nightmare, and Dream Eater.

Minor Gift - Detect Heretic.title: Minor Gift - Detect Heretic
Minor Gift - Detect Heretic.description: You intuitively sense the presence of those with non-MissingNo Gifts around you, though you have no way of telling who they might be. The more Gifts someone has, the further away you can sense them, though you generally cannot sense even the strongest of Gift holders at a distance of more than 15 meters away from you.

Minor Gift - Death Sense.title: Minor Gift - Death Sense
Minor Gift - Death Sense.description: When encountering a corpse, you can always tell how many hours ago the Pokémon or Trainer has died, for up to a week after their death.

Minor Gift - Death Dealer.title: Minor Gift - Death Dealer
Minor Gift - Death Dealer.description: Injuries you inflict will not heal at the normal rate and require extensive medical treatment, such as staying at a Poke Center, to heal. Instead of recovering at the normal rate of three Injuries per day while at such a facility, they heal at a rate of one injury a day.

Minor Gift - Dazzling the Stage.title: Minor Gift - Dazzling the Stage
Minor Gift - Dazzling the Stage.description: Whenever you use song or dance for Intimidate, Guile, or Charm, you may add half of the highest Skill Rank you have among these Skills to your Skill Check.

Minor Gift - Cloud Reading.title: Minor Gift - Cloud Reading
Minor Gift - Cloud Reading.description: You get a +3 bonus to Survival Checks to discern upcoming weather from observing clouds in the sky.

Minor Gift - Chosen of Victory.title: Minor Gift - Chosen of Victory
Minor Gift - Chosen of Victory.description: Whenever you spend AP to raise your roll on an Accuracy Check, you get +3 bonus instead of +1.

Minor Gift - Catastrophe Sense.title: Minor Gift - Catastrophe Sense
Minor Gift - Catastrophe Sense.description: You have an intuitive sense of when natural disasters or other catastrophes are likely to occur near you.

Minor Gift - Alien Countenance.title: Minor Gift - Alien Countenance
Minor Gift - Alien Countenance.description: You may add your Mind Modifier instead of your Body Modifier to your Intimidate Checks. You get a +2 bonus to Intimidate Checks against Pokémon.

Medic Training.title: Medic Training
Medic Training.description: When you use Restorative Items on others, they do not forfeit their next turn.

Master Skills.title: Master Skills
Master Skills.description: You Rank Up a Skill from Expert to Master. You may take this Edge multiple times.

Leader.title: Leader
Leader.description: You learn the Move After You.

Kip Up.title: Kip Up
Kip Up.description: You may stand up from being Tripped as a Swift Action

Iron Mind.title: Iron Mind
Iron Mind.description: You become aware of all attempts to read your mind with Telepathy, whether the attempt is successful or not.

Instruction.title: Instruction
Instruction.description: Whenever you aid an ally in an Assisted Skill Check using an Education Skill you have at Novice Rank or higher, add your full Rank value as a bonus to their roll instead of half.

Instinctive Aptitude.title: Instinctive Aptitude
Instinctive Aptitude.description: Whenever you spend AP to raise your roll on an Accuracy Roll or Skill Check, you get a +2 bonus instead of +1. This cannot be used on Rolls made by your Pokémon.

Groomer.title: Groomer
Groomer.description: You know how to effectively groom your Pokémon with access to a Groomer's Kit. You may groom up to 6 Pokémon in one hour. Grooming Pokémon may count as an hour of Training, and you may apply Experience Training, teach Poke-Edges, and apply any Features that could be applied during Training. If you apply Experience Training from Grooming, use your General Education or Pokémon Education Rank to determine Bonus Experience gained during Training. A Pokémon that has been Groomed also gains a +1d6 Bonus to the Introduction Roll of a Contest for the rest of the day.

Green Thumb.title: Green Thumb

fields.value: Novice General Education or Novice Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

Green Thumb.description: You know how to grow Apricorns and Tier 1 Berries using a Portable Grower or Fertilized Soil.

Gravity Training.title: Gravity Training
Gravity Training.description: You gain the Gravitic Tolerance capability at a value of 1-3 or 2-4.

Grace.title: Grace

fields.value: Novice Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition
fields.name: Prerequisites

Grace.description: Your Pokémon may consume and benefit from 2 more Poffins each. If this Pokémon is traded to a Trainer without the Grace feature, these extra dice from additional Poffins are not lost, but a Trainer without Grace may not benefit from more than 6 Dice gained from Poffins. You may always use any of the Skills that are prerequisites for Grace in the Introduction Stage of a Contest to roll for Contest Stat Dice of any kind.

Glitched Existence.title: Glitched Existence

fields.value: Exposure to Glitch Phenomena, GM Permission
fields.name: Prerequisites

Glitched Existence.description: You gain +2 to all Skill rolls to deal with Glitch phenomena.

Gem Lore.title: Gem Lore
Gem Lore.description: As an Extended Action, you may turn a Shard into a Gem of one of its associated Types. Additionally, you can turn 4 Red Shards into a Fire Stone; 4 Blue Shards into a Water Stone; 4 Yellow Shards into a Thunder Stone; 4 Orange Shards into a Shiny Stone; 4 Green Shards into a Leaf Stone; or 4 Violet Shards into a Dusk Stone. You can also destroy any of these six Stones to gain 4 Shards of the corresponding color.

Flustering Charisma.title: Flustering Charisma
Flustering Charisma.description: When you hit with a Move with the Social keyword, the target takes a -2 penalty to Save Checks against Volatile Status Afflictions for 1 full round.

Field Clinic.title: Field Clinic
Field Clinic.description:
Whenever your party Sets Up Camp, you may spend $200 worth of Medical Scrap to set up a Field Clinic. While using the Field Clinic, all members gain the following benefits;
» You may spend $300 of Medical Scrap to create and apply a Bandage or use a First Aid Kit
» If you have the Nurse Feature, you may spend $300 to activate it without Draining AP.
» Potions, Super Potions, Hyper Potions, Full Restores, Revives, Energy Powders, and Energy Roots used in this area heal their target an additional 5 Hit Points.

Expert Trickster.title: Expert Trickster
Expert Trickster.description: You gain a +2 Opposed Checks with all Dirty Trick Maneuvers. The “Once per Scene per Foe” Limitation of each Dirty Trick Maneuver is expended only upon successfully affecting a foe with that Dirty Trick Maneuver.

Expert Skills.title: Expert Skills
Expert Skills.description: You Rank Up a Skill from Adept to Expert. You may take this Edge multiple times.

Expert Manipulator.title: Expert Manipulator
Expert Manipulator.description: You gain a +2 Opposed Checks with all Manipulate Maneuvers. The "Once per Scene per Foe" Limitation of each Manipulate Maneuver is expended only upon succesfully affecting a foe with that Manipulate Maneuver.

Emergency Repairs.title: Emergency Repairs
Emergency Repairs.description: You may repair vehicles as a standard action by making a Technology Education roll. You pay the amount of your roll and repair that much Hit Point damage to the vehicle. If the vehicle has any Breaches you may Patch one of them. Patched Breaches no longer count towards Breach Security but still count toward Breach Capacity.

Elemental Connection.title: Elemental Connection
Elemental Connection.description: Choose an Elemental Type. You gain a +2 bonus to Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, and Intuition Checks targeting Pokémon of that Type. You may not take Elemental Connection if you have the Mystic Senses Edge, and you may not take Mystic Senses if you have Elemental Connection.

Dynamism.title: Dynamism
Dynamism.description: Your initiative is increased by your Guile Rank.

Dream Architect.title: Dream Architect

fields.value: Adept Intuition, Pokémon Education, or Technology Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Dream Architect.description: You know how to operate Dream Machines and can use them to study and influence a Pokémon's dreams.

Demoralize.title: Demoralize
Demoralize.description: Whenever you land a Critical Hit on a foe, that foe becomes Vulnerable. Status-Class Moves with an Accuracy Roll can “Crit” for the purposes of activating this effect on a natural roll of 19 or higher, and any effects that expand your Critical-Hit Range also expand this range.

Defensive Hacking.title: Defensive Hacking

fields.value: Adept Technology Education, Novice Focus, Datajack Augmentation
fields.name: Prerequisites

Defensive Hacking.description: You may add your Focus Ranks as additional Damage Reduction while in digital battles. You may apply this Damage Reduction to Technology Education attacks.

Charmer.title: Charmer
Charmer.description: You learn the Move Baby-Doll Eyes.

Categoric Inclination.title: Categoric Inclination
Categoric Inclination.description: Choose Body, Mind, or Spirit. You gain a +1 Bonus to all Skill Checks of that Category.

Breeder.title: Breeder
Breeder.description: If you are able to give two Pokémon that are compatible for breeding at least 4 hours of time alone, you may make a Pokémon Education Check with a DC of 12. If you succeed, the Pokémon are guaranteed to produce an egg if you give them an additional 4 hours.

Beast Master.title: Beast Master
Beast Master.description: You may use Intimidate instead of Command to make Pokemon at 0 or 1 Loyalty obey your commands. You may also use Intimidate instead of Command to determine the limits and Bonus Experience from Training.

Basic Skills.title: Basic Skills
Basic Skills.description: You Rank Up a Skill from Pathetic to Untrained, or Untrained to Novice. You may take this Edge multiple times.

Basic Martial Arts.title: Basic Martial Arts
Basic Martial Arts.description: You learn the Move Rock Smash.

Basic Cooking.title: Basic Cooking
Basic Cooking.description: You may create “Candy Bars” or “Baby Food” with cooking ingredients costing $50. You may fluff the food in any reasonable manner you like.

Basic Balls.title: Basic Balls
Basic Balls.description: You may craft Basic Balls for $100 and Great Balls for $175. Requires access to a Poké Ball Tool Box.

Bad Mood.title: Bad Mood
Bad Mood.description: Your Critical Hit Range is increased by +1 if you are suffering from a Persistent Status Affliction. Your Critical Hit Range is increased by +1 if you are suffering from a Volatile Status Affliction. These stack with each other, giving a total of +2 to Critical Hit Range if you are suffering from both a Persistant and a Volatile Status Affliction.

Apricorn Balls.title: Apricorn Balls

fields.value: Novice Survival or Adept Technology Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Apricorn Balls.description: As an Extended Action, you may craft Apricorns into their corresponding Poké Ball. Use of this Feature requires access to a Poké Ball Tool Box.

Adept Skills.title: Adept Skills
Adept Skills.description: You Rank Up a Skill from Novice to Adept. You may take this Edge multiple times.

Acrobat.title: Acrobat
Acrobat.description: Increase your Jump and Long Jump Capabilities by +1 each.
